qas.question: What was contained within the book Elements?
Who was able to determine the the area under a parabola?
What method did Archimedes employ to determine the area under a parabola?
Which mathematical figure did Archimedes approximate?

context: In Hellenistic Egypt, the mathematician <a0_0>Euclid<a0_0/> laid down <a1_0>the foundations of mathematical rigor<a1_0/> and introduced the concepts of definition, axiom, theorem and proof still in use today in his Elements, considered the most influential textbook ever written. <a2_0>Archimedes<a2_0/>, considered one of the greatest mathematicians of all time, is credited with using the method of <a3_0>exhaustion<a3_0/> to calculate the area under the arc of a parabola with the summation of an infinite series, and gave a remarkably accurate approximation of <a4_0>Pi<a4_0/>. He is also known in physics for laying the foundations of hydrostatics, statics, and the explanation of the principle of the lever.
